DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of  cardiovascular complication related to surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Generalized Surgical Procedure Complication Cardiovascular System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._Relating to the heart and the blood vessels or the circulation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to the heart and the blood vessels or the circulation.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the heart and the blood vessels or the circulation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret as requested by D.Laurence. mc 6/15/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failure of the heart to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the needs of the body tissues, resulting in tissue congestion and edema. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, pitting edema, enlarged tender liver, engorged neck veins, and pulmonary rales.

Concepts.definition: Failure of the heart to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the needs of the body tissues, resulting in tissue congestion and edema. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, pitting edema, enlarged tender liver, engorged neck veins, and pulmonary rales.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sudden cessation of cardiac activity in an individual who becomes unresponsive, without normal breathing and no signs of circulation. Cardiac arrest may be reversed by CPR, and/or defibrillation, cardioversion or cardiac pacing.

Concepts.definition: The sudden cessation of cardiac activity in an individual who becomes unresponsive, without normal breathing and no signs of circulation. Cardiac arrest may be reversed by CPR, and/or defibrillation, cardioversion or cardiac pacing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any variation from the normal rate or rhythm (which may include the origin of the impulse and/or its subsequent propagation) in the heart.

Concepts.definition: Any variation from the normal rate or rhythm (which may include the origin of the impulse and/or its subsequent propagation) in the heart.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort) which has recently changed in frequency, duration, intensity, or occurs at rest.

Concepts.definition: Angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort) which has recently changed in frequency, duration, intensity, or occurs at rest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A myocardial infarction that produces elevation in the ST segments of the ECG.: A myocardial infarction that does not produce elevation in the ST segments of the ECG.: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

Concepts.longName: ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Concepts.definition: A myocardial infarction that produces elevation in the ST segments of the ECG.

Concepts.longName: Non-ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Concepts.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of a myocardial infarction that does not produce elevations in the ST segment of the EKG.
Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
